title: Minor injured in Northwest San Antonio shooting
content:
SAN ANTONIO — A teen-aged boy was shot in the arm on the Northwest Side on Sunday evening after he attempted to evade the gunman in his vehicle, police said.
Authorities were dispatched about 6:30 p.m. to 4900 View Drive and found a minor who sustained one gunshot wound to his arm.
The victim, whose identity has not been released, was dropping his friend off at a nearby apartment complex when he was approached by two men, said San Antonio Police Sgt. Thomas Haymaker.
The sergeant said one of the men fired at the driver for an unknown reason as he drove away from the scene. The victim was taken to University Hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.
Authorities do not have a description to identify the two suspects in the shooting.
No further details were immediately available.
